topics.title: Greet Someone
topics.prompt: Practice greeting someone and asking how they are.
topics.hint: 用英文打招呼並詢問對方的狀態，說 2-3 句。
topics.sample: Hello! How are you today? I hope you are feeling good.

topics.title: Express Your Feelings
topics.prompt: Talk about how you feel right now.
topics.hint: 用英文描述你現在的感覺，可以說 3-4 句，包含原因。
topics.sample: I am feeling tired because I didn’t sleep well last night. But I am also happy because I have a day off.

topics.title: Describe Your Day
topics.prompt: Describe a typical day and how you usually feel.
topics.hint: 用英文描寫你平常一天的活動和感受，說 4-5 句。
topics.sample: Usually, I wake up early and feel good. I go to work or school and sometimes feel hungry in the afternoon. At night, I feel tired and ready to sleep.

topics.title: Talk About Hunger
topics.prompt: Explain when and why you feel hungry during the day.
topics.hint: 用英文描述一天中什麼時候你會餓，並說明原因，說 3-4 句。
topics.sample: I usually feel hungry at noon because I skip breakfast sometimes. I like to eat lunch to feel better.

topics.title: Share How You Help Friends
topics.prompt: Talk about how you ask friends how they are and help them.
topics.hint: 用英文描述你如何關心朋友，說 3-5 句。
topics.sample: When I see my friends, I say hello and ask, 'How are you?' If they feel tired or sad, I try to cheer them up or help them.

topics.title: Talk About Saying Goodbye
topics.prompt: Describe how you say goodbye after a conversation.
topics.hint: 用英文描述你和朋友講完話後，如何道別，說 2-3 句。
topics.sample: After we talk, I usually say, 'Goodbye! Have a nice day!' It is polite and friendly.

topics.title: Imagine a Story Extension
topics.prompt: Imagine what happens after saying hello in the song.
topics.hint: 根據歌曲打招呼的情境，想像接下來發生了什麼事，說 4-5 句。
topics.sample: After saying hello, the friends decide to play together. They feel great and have fun. They eat snacks when they are hungry.

topics.title: Talk About Your Favorite Greeting
topics.prompt: Describe your favorite way to greet people and why.
topics.hint: 用英文說明你喜歡的問候語和原因，說 3-4 句。
topics.sample: My favorite greeting is saying 'Hi, how are you?' because it sounds friendly. It shows I care about the person.
